The Daintree Rainforest is located in tropical Far North Queensland, Australia. It is known for its high levels of rainfall throughout the year and is part of the Wet Tropics of Queensland. The soil in rainforests, including the Daintree, is often poor in nutrients due to heavy rainfall that can leach nutrients away. Additionally, rainforests are known for their incredible biodiversity and host a wide variety of organisms.
Therefore, the answer (English alphabet) is(A) It has year-round rain. It also has soil that is poor in nutrients.
